title: Particulate diagram - H2 and O2 form water vapor

content.question: Which of the following particulate diagrams best shows the formation of water vapor from hydrogen gas and oxygen gas in a rigid container at 125oC?

choices.label: Each figure shows two particulate representations containing small spheres and large spheres. The diagram on the left shows 6 small spheres and 6 large spheres. The spheres are scattered and do not touch. A directional arrow points from the diagram on the left to the diagram on the right. The diagram on the right shows 6 large spheres that do not touch. Each large sphere has two small spheres attached to it.

Option B. The diagram on the left shows 12 small spheres and 6 large spheres. The spheres are scattered and do not touch. A directional arrow points from the diagram on the left to the diagram on the right.  The diagram on the right is the same as the diagram on the right in Option A.

Option C. The diagram on the left shows 12 small spheres and 6 large spheres. Each sphere is attached to one other sphere of the same size, so there are six pairs of small spheres and three pairs of large spheres. The pairs are scattered such that no pair of spheres touches any other pair of spheres. A directional arrow points from the diagram on the left to the diagram on the right.  The diagram on the right is the same as the diagram on the right in Option A.

Option D. The diagram on the left shows 12 small spheres and 12 large spheres. Each sphere is attached to one other sphere of the same size, so there are six pairs of small spheres and six pairs of large spheres. The pairs are scattered such that no pair of spheres touches any other pair of spheres. A directional arrow points from the diagram on the left to the diagram on the right.  The diagram on the right is the same as the diagram on the right in Option A.

content.answer: Option C. The diagram on the left shows 12 small spheres and 6 large spheres. Each sphere is attached to one other sphere of the same size, so there are six pairs of small spheres and three pairs of large spheres. The pairs are scattered such that no pair of spheres touches any other pair of spheres. A directional arrow points from the diagram on the left to the diagram on the right.  The diagram on the right is the same as the diagram on the right in Option A.

skill.text: 3.B: Represent chemical substances or phenomena with appropriate diagrams or models (e.g., electron configuration).
